main.name: Alex Montague
main.description2: , whether that be open source projects, internships, or new technologies,
main.bio: I am a software engineer. Not only do I like to program, but I am passionate about writing clean, smart, and efficient code! Over my schooling and work terms I have been exposed to many languages and frameworks, but some of my favourite languages are Javascript, C and Python. I recently started my dive into web development, more specifically using the ReactJS/NodeJS libraries. I hope to explore more full stack opportunities in the future!

resume.skillmessage: Some technology I am passionate about, and an overview of my skills

education.description: Currently in my third year studying Software Engineering. Some of the most interesting/favourite courses I have taken so far have been Software Design I - IV, Data Structures, Algorithms, Operating Systems and the infamous 'Angel of Death' (Software Systems and Integrations). Currently on the Dean's List for maintaining an overall average of 80%. I am looking forward to my databases and software design V class.

Highschool is where I was first introduced to programming and computer science. I started learning the fundamentals using the Turing and Java programming languages. I graduated as an Ontario Scholar and maintained an overall average of 95% in all CIS courses.

work.title: Full Stack Developer
work.description: League is an all digital benefit providing platform that lets employees customize and tailor their benefits exactly how they want to. League was rated LinkedIn's 4th top startup in Canada, and I can really see why! I am currently working as a Full Stack developer writing ReactJS and Redux on the frontend, and Go on the backend which I absolutely love working with. I look forward to what comes in the coming months of this placement!

work.title: Student Web Developer
work.description: Coinsquare is a 21st century financial institution specializing in trading and managing cryptocurrencies. Coinsquare was rated the 2nd most sought after startup in Canada by LinkedIn! I joined the team as a student web developer and have been working on our web application for both the front end and backend teams. As one of Coinsquare's first interns, I had the pleasure of participating and presenting in the first ever Coinsquare hackathon, as well as being able to be a fully functioning and independent developer! This was an absolutely amazing placement and I have learned so much not just about web development, but also about blockchain technology, project management, leadership and communication in an agile team! Check out an article I wrote about my experiences

row1.text: I have been doing a lot of frontend work with the react library, and I absolutely love it! It is so versatile and is my go to for frontend web development. Pairing React with some other very powerful libraries and frameworks that I like (redux, axios, styled components) makes for a super strong frontend stack!

After recently branching out into backend web development, node, express and knex are some of the tools I am using to build my backend architecture. I am still learning lots about backend development!

row2.text: The C Programming language is the main language taught at UofG, and probably my strongest language. I liked the low-levelness of this language, and my algorithms and data structures classes all utilized C. Learning this language made me appreciate dynamic languages, but also allowed me to understand how they work behind the scenes.

After learning SQL at school through projects, I was able use these skills at my current co-op where we utilized MySQL and PostgreSQL. I still have much to learn (and my upcoming databased course will help) in terms of relational databases, but I am also open and exploring non-relational databases such as MongoDB for personal use.

row3.text: Java is my favourite OO language and I have been programming with Java since highschool. I made my first graphical application with Java while working at my previous job, check it out below!
Python is something I am still exploring/learning, but I am very interested in it as I would like to explore AI/Machine learning in the future. Not to mention no more curly braces and semicolons :)

projects.title: Cryptowatch
projects.category: An all in one web application to track and manage your crypto assets. No real money needed, just select the coin, the amount, and date bought and it will do the rest for you. This has been my first real web app that is constantly being developed.

projects.title: Book Buy
projects.category: Book Buy offers students a simple way of finding, buying and selling their textbooks. Book Buy instantly connects buyers and sellers for used textbooks that help students save money, time and effort. Created with a partner at The University of Guelph.

projects.title: am.ca Server
projects.category: My personal server hosted on a raspberry pi that I use for alexmontague.ca. Try pinging [api.alexmontague.ca/resume] for a JSON representation of my resume! Written using Golang and configured using nginx. I used this as an opportunity to learn more about Go and Netoworking!

projects.title: BubbleT
projects.category: BubbleT is an app that collects and displays salary records from Canada's public sector high earners. BubbleT was a team project for System Analysis and Design in Applications (CIS*3750, Winter 2019).

projects.title: Coinsquare Dashboard
projects.category: Dashboard application that was built in 4 hours for Coinsquare's first ever internal Hackathon. This dashboard allowed for constant monitoring of coinsquare's status, jira board, and Github PR data in a visualized way.

projects.title: Awesome Ancestors
projects.category: This program utilizes the GEDCOM file format (file format that reflects and displays ancestral data in a specific way. Used in sites like Ancestory.com), and was created for my 'Angel of Death' course. The program's main purpose is to read in a GEDCOM file, parse all information from the file, and manipulate the data to your liking. The program can create and edit new GEDCOM files, or modify existing files. The web client gives the user an interface to interact with and view the GEDCOM files.

projects.title: Greens Tracker
projects.category: This Java application was created to record and display data recorded during a hand watering shift at my previous Golf Course. This information was usually kept on paper and was an overall inefficient process I wanted to make better.

testimonials.text: 'One of the best programming skills you can have is knowing when to walk away for awhile.' - Oscar Godson.
testimonials.user: I love to program, but love interacting even more. I am ready to work on new and exciting things, with new and exciting people!
